solution_line_template: He walks {morning_walk_distance} miles in the morning and {evening_walk_distance} miles in the evening so that’s {morning_walk_distance}+{evening_walk_distance} = <<{morning_walk_distance}+{evening_walk_distance}={daily_walk_distance}>>{daily_walk_distance} miles

If he walks {daily_walk_distance} miles everyday, for {num_days} days then he walks {daily_walk_distance}*{num_days} = <<{daily_walk_distance}*{num_days}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles in {num_days} days
